text:
Heroic hound leads authorities to missing owner with Alzheimer’s Share View as Slideshow 1 
We’re proud to bring you another guest gallery. Have your own inspirational or heartwarming story you want to share? Submit your gallery to iCHIVE for a chance to have it featured on theCHIVE homepage, earn the “Great Scott” badge, as well as 3,000 Chive Points. 
A dog in Argentina saved the life of his owner, who has Alzheimer’s, when his illness caused him to go missing. 
Juan Pedro Aráoz, 80, was taking Simon for a walk when he became disoriented and got lost. Aráoz’s family called the authorities who searched for him all night and into the next day, when temperatures reached a sweltering 113 degrees. 
Then, firefighters saw a dog barking frantically at passersby. Living in the same neighborhood, the firefighters immediately recognized the dog as Simon. They followed the Labrador, who led them to a pasture where they found Aráoz laying on the ground, dangerously dehydrated and near the point of passing out. 
Aráoz was taken to the hospital where he and Simon were treated. 
If it weren’t for the loyalty of his beloved hound, Aráoz would have likely died in the heat. 2
